intro: Chaerophyllum tolucanum, commonly known as the Tolucan cowpea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, dry fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
